Package coffee.khyonieheart.eden.module.java

Class ModuleManager

java.lang.Object
coffee.khyonieheart.eden.module.java.ModuleManager
public class ModuleManager extends Object
Handler for all tasks related to Eden's modules.

This is divided up into a few services:

- Copying internal modules from Eden's plugin file

- Gathering modules from a file, and providing access to their classes post-runtime

- Enabling and disabling modules, and registering/unregistering their commands and listeners

- Obtaining modules of different statuses in different areas

    • loadSingleModule

      public Result loadSingleModule(String filepath, boolean syncEvent)
      Loads a single module from a filepath.
      Parameters:
      filepath - The filepath leading to the module file.
      syncEvent - Whether or not to synchronize the resulting ModuleLoadEvent. This is required when attempting to asynchronously load modules.
      Returns:
      A result of either an EdenModule or a String describing the error.

      Returns:
      A result of either an EdenModule or a String describing the error.

      public void enableModule(EdenModule module)
      Loads a module, calling it's onEnable() and registering its commands and listeners, and does not attempt to synchronize the resulting ModuleEnableEvent.
      Parameters:
      module - The module to load.

    • enableModule

      public void enableModule(EdenModule module, boolean syncEvent)
      Loads a module, calling it's onEnable() and registering its commands and listeners.
      Parameters:
      module - The module to load.
      syncEvent - Whether or not to synchronize the resulting ModuleEnableEvent. This is required when attempting to asynchronously enable modules.

    • disableModule

      public Option disableModule(String name, CallerToken caller, List<EdenModule> disabledModuleList, boolean syncEvent, boolean force)
      Disables a module, unregistering its commands and listeners.
      Parameters:
      name - The expected name of a module.
      caller - The token of the requestee.
      disabledModuleList - A list to be populated with a number of downstream disabled modules.
      syncEvent - Whether or not the ModuleDisableEvent should be triggered synchronously.

      - If you are unsure, false is generally safe.

      force - Whether or not to force downstream modules to be disabled as well.
      Returns:
      Whether or not disabling was successful.
      Optional type:
      ModuleDisableFailureData

    • disableModule

      public Option disableModule(String name)
      Attempts to disable an enabled module. Runs with caller token PLAYER, and does not attempt to force a disable if a downstream module fails to be disabled. The resulting ModuleDisableEvent will be run asynchronously. See disableModuleSync(String name) if synchronization is needed.
      Parameters:
      name - The expected name of a module.
      Returns:
      An option containing either NONE or a ModuleDisableFailureData object, providing details and tools on disable failure
      Optional type:
      ModuleDisableFailureData

    • disableModule

      public Option disableModule(String name, CallerToken token)
      Attempts to disable an enabled module. Does not attempt to force a disable if a downstream module fails to be disabled. The resulting ModuleDisableEvent will be run asynchronously. See disableModuleSync(String name, CallerToken token) if synchronization is needed.
      Parameters:
      name - The expected name of a module.
      token - Privilege level of caller
      Returns:
      An option containing either NONE or a ModuleDisableFailureData object, providing details and tools on disable failure
      Optional type:
      ModuleDisableFailureData

    • disableModule

      public Option disableModule(String name, boolean force)
      Attempts to disable an enabled module. Runs with caller token PLAYER. The resulting ModuleDisableEvent will be run asynchronously. See disableModuleSync(String name, boolean force) if synchronization is needed.
      Parameters:
      name - The expected name of a module.
      force - Whether or not to continue with a disable operation if a downstream module fails to be correctly disabled
      Returns:
      An option containing either NONE or a ModuleDisableFailureData object, providing details and tools on disable failure
      Optional type:
      ModuleDisableFailureData

    • disableModule

      public Option disableModule(String name, CallerToken token, boolean force)
      Attempts to disable an enabled module. Runs with caller token PLAYER. The resulting ModuleDisableEvent will be run asynchronously. See disableModuleSync(String name, CallerToken token, boolean force) if synchronization is needed.
      Parameters:
      name - The expected name of a module.
      token - Privilege level of caller
      force - Whether or not to continue with a disable operation if a downstream module fails to be correctly disabled
      Returns:
      An option containing either NONE or a ModuleDisableFailureData object, providing details and tools on disable failure
      Optional type:
      ModuleDisableFailureData

    • disableModuleSync

      public Option disableModuleSync(String name)
      Attempts to disable an enabled module, running the resulting ModuleDisableEvent in sync with the server. Runs with caller token PLAYER, and does not attempt to force a disable if a downstream module fails to be disabled.
      Parameters:
      name - The expected name of a module.
      token - Privilege level of caller
      force - Whether or not to continue with a disable operation if a downstream module fails to be correctly disabled
      Returns:
      An option containing either NONE or a ModuleDisableFailureData object, providing details and tools on disable failure
      Optional type:
      ModuleDisableFailureData

    • disableModuleSync

      public Option disableModuleSync(String name, CallerToken token)

      Parameters:
      name - The expected name of a module.
      token - Privilege level of caller
      Returns:

    • removeModuleFromMemory

      public void removeModuleFromMemory(String name, CallerToken caller)
      Removes an EdenModule from memory. Modules being unloaded are expected to already be disabled.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the module to remove.
      caller - The token for the caller.

    • forceRemoveModuleFromMemory

      public void forceRemoveModuleFromMemory(String name, boolean syncEvent)
      Forcibly unloads an EdenModule from memory. This method bypasses CallerTokens, @PreventUnload annotations, and other safety checks.

      This is not intended to be a bypass of the standard module removal protocol.

      As such, issues arising from improper usage of this utility will be ignored.
      Parameters:
      name - Module name to unload.
      syncEvent - Whether or not to synchronize the resulting ModuleUnloadEvent

    • forceReload

      public boolean forceReload(String name, boolean enableIfDisabled, boolean syncEvent, boolean continueOnFailure)
      Forcibly reloads a module.
      Parameters:
      name - Module name to reload.
      enableIfDisabled - Whether or not to enable the reloaded module, even if it was previously disabled.
      syncEvent - Whether or not to synchronize all the events generated by this method
      continueOnFailure - Whether or not to continue on a failure, ensuring that the module will be reloaded. This may result in configs not being updated.
      Returns:
      Whether or not the reload was successful

    • getCachedClass

      public Class<?> getCachedClass(String name)
      Obtain a class instance from a loaded module class cache.
      Parameters:
      name - The fully-qualified classname to get
      Returns:
      The class under the given classname

    • getHostModule

      public Option getHostModule(Class<?> clazz)
      Finds the module a class is associated with.

      Results:

      SOME - A module was found. Unwrap to obtain module. If null, class was not found anywhere.

      NONE - Class was found outside of a module.

      Parameters:
      clazz - The class to search with.
      Returns:
      Option containing a module on SOME, no module if NONE, or Some(null) if a class was not found anywhere
      Optional type:
      EdenModule

    • getReliantModules

      public List<EdenModule> getReliantModules(EdenModule target)
      Obtains a list of reliant (dependencies from the module being depended on's perspective) modules related to the given module.
      Parameters:
      target - Module to obtain a list of reliant modules with
      Returns:
      A list of reliant modules that depend on the given module.

    • setClass

      Parameters:
      name - The fully-qualified name of the given class.
      class_ - The class to assign.

      public boolean isModulePresent(String name)

      Parameters:
      name - The expected module name.
      Returns:
      Whether or not a module with a given name is enabled or not. Returns false if the module cannot be found.

    • isModuleListPresent

      public boolean isModuleListPresent(String... names)
      Checks if an array of modules, by name, are all present. Returns false if one or more modules are missing.
      Parameters:
      names - An array of expected module names.
      Returns:
      Whether or not a set of modules are enabled.
